schema.description: Provides response data for a specific user.

items.description: Specifies details for a user's alias.

aliasId.description: A unique identifier for the user's alternate username.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the alias was created.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the alias was last modified.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the user account was created.

deviceCount.description: The number of authentication devices enrolled by the user in Akamai MFA. The user can enroll and use a set of authentication devices. The supported device types include the following: `PUSH`. Any device that supports sending push notifications, for example, tablets and smartphones. `PHONE_ONLY`. A non-smartphone mobile device that supports only text messages and calls. `SECURITY_KEY`. A FIDO2 WebAuthn security key such as a YubiKey or Akamai MFA phone security key. `TOTP`. A hardware device that generates one-time passcodes. `HARDWARE_TOKEN`. A security device that generates one-time passcodes.

devices.description: Authentication devices the user enrolled in Akamai MFA.

items.description: Provides response data for a specific user device.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the device was created.

deviceId.description: Uniquely identifies the authentication device enrolled by the user.

deviceName.description: A user-friendly name to identify the authentication device.

deviceType.description: A user's type of authentication device. Refer to [API concepts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/mfa/reference/mfa-concepts) to learn about device types.

isDeviceEnabled.description: Whether the authentication device is enabled in Akamai MFA. You can disable a user's device that remains inactive or poses a threat to your data. Users can't use a deactivated device to confirm their identity. Disabling a device is reversible, and isn't the same as permanently deleting a device. See [Enable a device](https://techdocs.akamai.com/mfa/reference/post-enable-user-device) and [Disable a device](https://techdocs.akamai.com/mfa/reference/post-disable-user-device) for details on how to manage user devices.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the device was last modified, or when it was last used since then.

platform.description: The platform of the authentication device.

summary.description: Summary of the group. Indicates what the group represents.

importSource.description: The imported user's provisioning source. A `null` value marks manually imported users.

id.description: A unique identifier for the imported user's provisioning source.

type.description: The imported user's provisioning source, either `SCIM` or `EAA`.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the user account was last modified.

userId.description: A unique identifier for each user account.

userStatus.description: The status of the user account, either `ACTIVE`, `UNENROLLED`, `DEVICES_DISABLED`, or `PROVISIONING_DISABLED`. Refer to [API concepts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/mfa/reference/mfa-concepts) to learn more about user account status.

username.description: The user's username. The username is unique for the tenant.

parameters.description: For customers who manage more than one account, this [runs the operation from another account](https://techdocs.akamai.com/developer/docs/manage-many-accounts-with-one-api-client). schema.description: Provides response data for all devices enrolled by the user.

devices.description: Authentication devices the user enrolled in Akamai MFA.

items.description: Provides response data for a specific user device.

createdDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the device was created.

deviceId.description: Uniquely identifies the authentication device enrolled by the user.

deviceName.description: A user-friendly name to identify the authentication device.

deviceType.description: A user's type of authentication device. Refer to [API concepts](https://techdocs.akamai.com/mfa/reference/mfa-concepts) to learn about device types.

isDeviceEnabled.description: Whether the authentication device is enabled in Akamai MFA. You can disable a user's device that remains inactive or poses a threat to your data. Users can't use a deactivated device to confirm their identity. Disabling a device is reversible, and isn't the same as permanently deleting a device. See [Enable a device](https://techdocs.akamai.com/mfa/reference/post-enable-user-device) and [Disable a device](https://techdocs.akamai.com/mfa/reference/post-disable-user-device) for details on how to manage user devices.

modifiedDate.description: ISO 8601 timestamp marking when the device was last modified, or when it was last used since then.

platform.description: The platform of the authentication device.

200.description: The response provides a list of the user's devices.

post.description: Assign a hardware token to a specific user account. To assign a hardware token, you need the token's serial number. You can also unassign and reassign a hardware token from one active user account to another. A hardware token assigned to a user account gets automatically unassigned when the account is deleted, and returns to the pool of available tokens that you can assign to another user.
